headers.subject: Re: drivers

quote.quotepara: I have an Astra 6450 that works wonderfully with VueScan and has for about one to two years or so.

body.para: from the VueScan site: (See Jared's and my previous posts on this thread for the URL)

USB Flatbed scanners supported: All Epson models Canon FB630U, FB636U, FB1210U, N650U, N656U, D660U, N670U, N676U, N1220U, N1240U, LIDE 20, LIDE 30 HP 2100C, 2200C, 4100C, 5200C, 5300C, 6200C, 6300C, 7400C Microtek X12USL, 4700, 5600, 5700, 6700 (1200 dpi and below), 6800 (without ICE) and 8700 UMAX 3400 (some versions), 5400 BearPaw 1200, 2400 Genius ColorPage-HR6 Plustek OpticPro Most Acer/BenQ, AGFA models

Notice that he makes specific mention of two and only two models of UMAX scanners. Notice that the UMAX Astra 2100U is not one of the models so listed. I've tried VueScan, even though the 2100 isn't on the Officially Supported list. As promised, VueScan does not work with the 2100.
Please note that the relevant paragraph from my original post, which you snipped, was:
"If anyone ever writes an OS X native driver for low-end USB scanners such as the UMAX Astra 2100 I figure that they have a market... so long as the price is right."

The fact that the 6450 may/may not work with VueScan is irrelevant. What is relevant is that UMAX has elected to not supply OS X drivers for the majority of its scanners, and that only a few are supported by a third party. As the 6450 is not officially supported, support for it may go away in later versions of VueScan. It would seem to indicate that it would be a bad idea to buy UMAX scanners if you intend to use OS X, based on the available info. It appears that their OS X support is, to put it kindly, spotty. It would be better to support another vendor, one which supports OS X.
However, if someone is silly enough to buy a UMAX scanner despite _knowing_ about UMAX's lack of support, well I can't stop them.

quote.quotepara: If VueScan supported the Astra, it'd have lots of sales, given the number of Astras sold. However, as there doesn't seem to be much movement on the driver front, I suspect that most Astra owners will simply buy a new scanner which _does_ have OS X drivers, probably _not_ one from UMAX.
